alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Chouteau; Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 10:22PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from showers will impact portions of northern Blaine, southeastern Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1020 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds associated with shower activity over Blaine, Chouteau, and Hill Counties. This activity was moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Harlem, Azure, Parker School, Agency, St. Pierre, Sangrey, Boneau, Fort Belknap, Box Elder, Rocky Boy, Lohman, Cleveland, Zurich, Laredo and Lloyd. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 388 and 439. Highway 87 between mile markers 83 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
